items.title: Chief of Digital Services
items.org: Family & Medical Leave Insurance (FAMLI), Maryland Department of Labor
items.description: Third hire to the Digital Service team building out a greenfield digital-first service to support Maryland workers and employers in the rollout of paid family and medical leave for the state. Initially hired as tech lead for front-end and accessibility, then promoted to lead the overall team of 15 state employees with expertise in product leadership, service design, content strategy, engineering, accessibility and devops and oversee our agile vendor contracts worth $15.6 million annually.
leadership: Guided cross-functional team in exploration of complex program requirements, including documentation for shared understanding across the division and shaped the program strategy to deliver on them
Created and implemented collaborative planning processes to break down the work of this multi-year endeavor, including regular transparent updates to key leadership partners and stakeholders
Developed the hiring process for key roles on the team and served as hiring manager for 6 of the team's early hires
Coached and managed 9 senior members of the Digital Services team, including other managers
technical: Led build vs buy strategy for the program and partnered with product, design and engineering leads on foundational decisions around tech stack, tooling and third-party tools/services
Established standards and documentation for the engineering team, specifically around accessibility and front-end performance
culture: Established team processes and promoted team culture of exploration, iteration and collaboration

items.title: Engineering Manager
items.description: Founded in 2012, Panorama Education helps students achieve academic success and well-being, and gives schools and school districts a platform to hear what families, students and teachers need in the classroom.
leadership: Refined how the engineering team supported customer support requests, including improvements to our cross-functional communication and tools
Strateged on zone-wide plans and collaborated on change management for those plans
Updated the promotion process for all engineers and led the biannual review process
Coached and developed mainly senior engineers, including facilitating promotions for 4 engineers over 3 quarters
technical: Led strategy and delivery for 3 separate cross-functional teams in partnership with product and design, assuring efficiency and impact for our users in over 1500 school systems in all 50 states
culture: Rebooted a dormant affinity group for women, gender-nonconforming and nonbinary employees, providing a point of connection and support for team members

items.title: Engineering Manager, Front-end
items.description: Founded in 2012, Lumen Learning uses open educational resources (OER) to provide affordable course materials that improve learning and replace expensive textbooks in high-enrollment college courses. Over 400 institutions across the U.S. use Lumen's award-winning digital courseware for in-person, online, and blended courses.
leadership: Developed career progression strategy, providing engineering team with meaningful titles and clear expectations for each level
Responsible for growing front-end team from 2 to 4, including developing hiring and onboarding processes that were then adopted by entire engineering team
Improving and reconciling fragmented team workflows
Collaborating closely with product managers, developers and designer to scope and estimate work to achieve our product roadmap
Coaching 5 team members at a variety of skill levels
Organizing and running team meetings, including sprint planning and retrospectives
technical: Planning and implementing front-end features and bug fixes across our products
Providing guidelines to developers and content team for creating inclusive and accessible markup and about testing with screen readers
Writing documentation and participating in code review
culture: Conducting company-wide workshop on accessibility and inclusive design principles
Establishing and modeling engineering team norms, specifically around learning/professional development and employee wellness

items.title: Adjunct Professor
responsibilities: Instructing undergraduate students in GD 220 (Graphic Design 2) and GD 431 (Front End Web development)
Developing curriculum and assignments for each 16-week course
Working 1:1 with students and providing detailed code review in response to assignments

items.title: Front-end Lead + Manager
items.description: Fractured Atlas builds software and provides services to help over 500,000 artists and arts organizations handle the business side of their work, like raising money, tracking donors and selling event tickets.
leadership: Served as project lead for crowdfunding and fundraising tool (over $25 million annually)
Managed UX engineering team, including holding 1:1s and setting team priorities
technical: Provided coding guidelines for writing maintainable Sass and inclusive and accessible markup
Built and deployed design system to establish a consistent look and feel across a variety of applications
Created site wireframes and prototypes to improve internal discussions and planning about site features and organization
culture: Developed and presented all-staff training on accessibility testing and best practices
Provided guidance on the organization's transition to being wholly virtual/remote (including being featured on our blog)

items.title: Senior Front-end Developer
items.description: Detroit Trading Company aggregates in-market automotive shopper intelligence, providing data that is responsible for more than $1 billion in monthly car sales.
leadership: Collaborated across the company, including CEO, .NET and Angular developers, designer and sales, to advocate for UX and to complete successful projects
technical: Led A-B testing of lead-generation forms to increase engagement and conversion. Lead funnel conversion increased from ~5% to more than 10% through improvements to copy, design and mobile layout.
Responsible for front-end development of our brand sites, online automotive shopping tools (for brands such as Time, AutoGuide, CNET and Kmart) and data-driven dashboards for our clients
Created brand style guide and built component-based Sass stylesheets to make development more efficient
Developed wireframes and prototypes to improve internal discussions and planning about site features and organization

items.title: Freelance Web Designer + Developer
items.description: Designed and coded web sites for clients, including small and mid-size businesses, nonprofits, educational institutions and individuals. Majority of projects were bespoke WordPress sites, including custom themes, custom content types and custom plugin development. Handled lead generation and client relations and education/training.

items.title: Superpowered Front-end Theming with Sass & SMACSS Workshop
National Women In Tech Nonprofit
items.description: Baltimore chapter leader and teacher from 2013–2017. Organized and presented hands-on workshops for women to learn web and software development. Coordinated teachers and volunteer teaching assistants across a wide variety of tech subjects. Built relationships with local companies and nonprofits who can provide space for our classes or other sponsorship opportunities. At the time I stepped down, the chapter had 1500+ members and had hosted 60+ events.

items.title: Creative Mixtape
items.description: Collaborative events between 7 Baltimore professional design associations. Participated in event and sponsorship logistics, including development of the one-page event site for our kickoff December 2016 event.

items.title: Bmore on Rails, AIGA, Mesh Baltimore
ChangeEngine
items.description: Wrote a column on the intersection of art and measurable impact from 2012–2014 (archive of articles)

items.title: Tech Mission Org of the Year
PASSHE Women's Consortium Annual Undergraduate Women's Leadership Institution Scholarship
